content.description: A short, exciting, mildly overhanging hand crack. A fun, quality problem with good jams. Although it appears wide in the pic, most of the jams are pretty tight.
content.protection: Pad and spotter. Can be roped if desired. Mostly flat landing, except for the tree roots.
content.location: Sits by itself on the West side of The Little Dome. Situated between Morning Veranda and Pirate Rocks, near the Shuttle Rocks. If you are walking North from Morning Veranda or Just Right Wall toward Pirate Rocks you should see it on your right.

content.description: A short, easy, fist or layback problem found in a dihedral.
content.location: Located on the Front side of the Little Dome toward the West end of the parking lot. Visible from the parking lot.

content.description: The problem traverses the horizontal edge of the boulder under Midget Corner.  Part of the Campside Boulders.
content.protection: You'll want at least one pad (two would be better) and a spotter.
content.location: North of campsite campsite 25. Approximate GPS coordinates are 30.497500N -98.824400W.

content.description: A sweet left arching crack that is about fist size.  It's a little crumbly on top so be careful topping out.  Part of the campside boulders.
content.protection: Boulder pad for sure a spotter would be real nice.
content.location: North of campsite 27.  Approximate GPS coordinates are 30.498000N -98.823600W.

content.description: There are a handful of small somewhat obscure climbing venues and isolated problems scattered around the Little Dome. This "Area" is intended as a place to list these climbs, boulder problems, or smaller venues.
